sentences.sContent: Later I take the funicular train, with its outstanding panoramic views.
sentences.sContent_eng: Later I take the funicular train, with its outstanding panoramic views.
sentences.sCn: 后来我乘缆车观赏了全景式的景观。

sentences.sContent: This summer I want to take my son on the funicular railway which runs up the mountain to the top of the castle gardens.
sentences.sContent_eng: This summer I want to take my son on the funicular railway which runs up the mountain to the top of the castle gardens.
sentences.sCn: 这个夏天我想带我儿子乘坐缆车到山顶上的城堡花园去玩。

sentences.sContent: Fog covers the valleys behind as a man is abseiled from a cable car during an annual rescue exercise at the funicular to Mount Pilatus (6, 982 ft) near Luzer, Switzerland on Nov. 9.
sentences.sContent_eng: Fog covers the valleys behind as a man is abseiled from a cable car during an annual rescue exercise at the funicular to Mount Pilatus (6, 982 ft) near Luzer, Switzerland on Nov. 9.
sentences.sCn: 瑞士—Luzer： 一年一次的救援演习中，一名男子正吊在通往皮拉图斯峰（pilatusi）的索道上滑行。 在他下面，山谷被大雾覆盖。

trans.tranOther: a small railway that carries people up and down a steep hill or mountain, pulled by a thick metal rope
